'''Bayleef''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ベイリーフ''' ''Bayleaf'') is a {{type|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Chikorita}} starting at [[level]] 16 and evolves into {{p|Meganium}} starting at level 32.

==Biology==
Bayleef resembles a pale yellow {{wp|sauropod}} dinosaur or a {{wp|lizard}}. A large leaf shaped like a scythe protrudes from its head. Curled leaf-like growths, stated to be buds with small tree shoots inside, sprout in a ring around its neck. It has red eyes, a short, blunt snout, and a short, pointed tail. There is one large toenail on each of its four feet.

The aroma wafting from the leaf-like growths around its neck has a spicy scent, and exhibits various beneficial effects on itself, nearby people, or Pokémon who inhale it. The fragrance has a combination of energizing, stimulating, and healing effects. Bayleef can be rarely found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grasslands}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Bayleef.png|thumb|left|210px|Bayleef in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Bayleef]]====
{{Ash}}'s {{p|Chikorita}} evolved into Bayleef in ''[[EP199|Current Events]]''. Ash's Bayleef still had the same personality it had when it was still a Chikorita, but it soon mellowed out.

====[[Casey's Bayleef]]====
Bayleef debuted when {{an|Casey}}'s Chikorita evolved into it in ''[[EP161|The Bug Stops Here]]''. It evolved again into a {{p|Meganium}} off-screen prior to the events of ''[[EP261|Here's Lookin' At You, Elekid!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Crystal Megaree Bayleef.png|thumb|150px|Bayleef in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Megaree}}
In ''[[PS135|Lively Larvitar]]'' of [[Pokémon Adventures]], {{adv|Crystal}}'s Chikorita, nicknamed Megaree, evolves into a Bayleef while defending her Trainer against an attack from an old foe, an impish wild {{p|Larvitar}}. She evolved with her fellow starter Pokémon in the fight against {{p|Lugia}} in the [[Whirl Islands]].

===In the Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys manga===
{{main|Gold's Bayleef}}
In [[Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys]], {{GnB|Gold}} has a Bayleef that used to belong to {{GnB|Black}}, but was released by its former Trainer for being too weak. After joining Gold's team, it has been able to defeat strong opponents such as [[Bugsy's Scyther]].
{{-}}

==Trivia==
* Bayleef is the tallest of the second-stage evolutions of starter Pokémon.
* Bayleef's "necklace" is consistently described as having a spicy aroma, while real {{wp|bay leaves}} have a bitter and herbal taste, which is similar to {{wp|thyme}}.

===Origin===
Bayleef is based on a group of {{wp|dinosaurs}} called {{wp|sauropods}}, specifically the ''{{wp|Apatosaurus}}''. Its vegetable part is based on the leaves of the {{wp|bay laurel}}, which oil is used for healing and as a stimulant in aromatherapy.

====Name origin====
Bayleef is a corruption of ''{{wp|bay leaf}}'', an herb.
